questions.question: When the Reynolds number is between 2000 and 4000, the flow is considered:

explanations.c: Re between 2000 and 4000 indicates transitional flow. Read more
explanations.d: Chaotic flow is not a standard category.

questions.question: Reynolds number is a dimensionless quantity because:

answers.a: Its units cancel out during calculation
answers.c: It is only used for gases

explanations.a: All units cancel in the formula, making it dimensionless. Source
explanations.b: It does have physical meaningâ€”it classifies flow type.
explanations.c: It is used for both liquids and gases.

questions.question: What happens to Reynolds number if the velocity of the fluid is doubled (keeping all other parameters constant)?

explanations.a: Re is directly proportional to velocity.
explanations.b: Velocity increase causes Re to change.
explanations.d: It would quadruple only if velocity were squared in the formula, which it is not.

questions.question: Which of the following flow conditions is most likely to cause vibration and noise in pipelines?

explanations.a: Laminar flow is smooth and silent.
explanations.b: Turbulent flow is chaotic and can cause noise and vibration. Source
explanations.c: Transition is less likely but may introduce minor disturbances.
explanations.d: Static flow means no motion, hence no vibration.

questions.question: Which parameter change is most effective in converting turbulent flow into laminar flow?

explanations.a: Higher velocity increases Re, leading to more turbulence.
explanations.b: Density has a limited effect compared to viscosity.
explanations.c: Increasing diameter may increase Re due to larger D.
explanations.d: Higher viscosity lowers Re and promotes laminar flow. Learn more
